CatDescriptText: Dr. J. A .Weyandt, dentist, Dormont and Willa Sweeney, Hill District, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 4, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think there is immediate danger of a third world war?  Why? If so, whom do you think our allies will be?"  Dr. Weyandt's answer reads: "No, I don't think so.  I just have that feeling.  I can't see  how any power with the least amount of common sense could think of war."  Mrs. Sweeney's answer reads: "I think so, and the reason is because there is too much uneasiness especially in the small counties."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Dr. J.A. Weyandt wearing hat, eyeglasses, and bow tie, holding cigarette, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Willa Sweeney wearing light colored striped dress and cardigan over shoulders, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
